Capitalism - particularly at this late stage - produces what David Graeber called "bullshit jobs" - meaningless, pointless, unrewarding jobs that contribute little to  society and function mainly just to maintain capitalist hierarchy - the status quo.  As Marx pointed out, competition between capitalists drives continuous uptake of technology and automation in the quest for improved productivity. That trend cannot abate for long or the system collapses. Most of the real needs of society are produced by a small subset of jobs. And it's a subset that's getting smaller and smaller.
